content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- Total blocks: 8 blocks
- Layers: 3 layers

## Spatial Relationships
- Base layer: 4 orange cylindrical blocks (pillars) arranged in a square formation
- Middle layer: 2 yellow rectangular blocks forming a platform across the top of the pillars
- Top layer: 
  - 1 orange cylindrical block standing vertically on top of the yellow platform
  - 1 orange triangular block on the right side of the platform
  - 1 yellow semi-cylindrical block (curved top) sitting on the top of the orange vertical cylinder

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis, the following blocks are needed:

1. Block #5 - Vertical orange cylinder (used 5 times: 4 for base pillars, 1 for top pillar)
2. Block #3 - Horizontal yellow rectangular block (used 2 times for the platform)
3. Block #8 - Yellow semi-cylindrical curved block (used 1 time for the top)
4. Block #15 - Orange triangular block (used 1 time for the right side on top)

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 5
  Step2: Move block with index 5
  Step3: Move block with index 5
  Step4: Move block with index 5
  Step5: Move block with index 3
  Step6: Move block with index 3
  Step7: Move block with index 5
  Step8: Move block with index 15
  Step9: Move block with index 8
}
```

This assembly order builds the structure from bottom to top: first the four base pillars, then the two yellow rectangular blocks to form the platform, followed by the top orange cylinder, the orange triangular block on the right side, and finally the yellow curved block on the very top.
